TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HttpFileCollection extends System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase

Docs.summary: Provides access to and organizes files uploaded by a client.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Clients encode files and transmit them in the content body using multipart MIME format with an HTTP `Content-Type` header of `multipart/form-data`. ASP.NET extracts the encoded file(s) from the content body into individual members of an HttpFileCollection. Methods and properties of the <xref:System.Web.HttpPostedFile> class provide access to the contents and properties of each file.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the HttpFileCollection collection returned from the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Files%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object. The HttpFileCollection collection is populated by two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FileUpload> controls on the Web page. Items in the file collection are displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
[!code-vb[System.Web.HttpFileCollection1#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.httpfilecol_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.HttpFileCollection1#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.httpfilecol_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a string array containing the keys (names) of all members in the file collection.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example loads the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> names transmitted from a client into a string array.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpFileCollection.AllKeys Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.httpfilecol_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpFileCollection.AllKeys Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.httpfilecol_1_1.cs)]

Docs.param: The index of the destination array where copying starts.
Docs.summary: Copies members of the file collection to an <xref:System.Array> beginning at the specified index of the array.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.HttpPostedFile Get(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the object to be returned from the file collection.
Docs.summary: Returns the object with the specified numerical index from the file collection.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example retrieves the first file object (index = 0) from the collection sent by the client and retrieves the name of the file represented by the object.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpFileCollection.Get1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpfilecol_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpFileCollection.Get1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpfilecol_0_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.HttpPostedFile Get(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the object to be returned from a file collection.
Docs.summary: Returns the object with the specified name from the file collection.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example retrieves the file object named "CustInfo" from the collection sent by the client and retrieves the name of the actual file represented by the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Web.HttpPostedFile> GetMultiple(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns all files that match the specified name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns a new collection instance each time it is called. This method should be called once per name per request.
